title: CLOSED THURSDAY NIGHT!
body:
Due to today's severe Winter weather, which has yet to let up, we will not be opening tonight (Thursday, November 30th). I'd hate to see anyone risk coming out in the current conditions... it's just not worth it. So let it snow and ice all night, and we'll dig out tomorrow.

Have a cozy evening, and we'll see you this weekend!
author: Dan

comments.author: El Brian de Moore
comments.body:
Posted By: Megsterand now i sort want pizza which...is ridiculous at ths hour...
dominos on cherry is open till 3am.. .... uhm.. but its 4am now.... twas a long night for me

comments.author: Caleb
comments.body: I always tip 20%, so if your pizza was $10, I would have given a $2 tip. However considering the snow/building, I would have upped it to $3. So Nate, you did good old man.

comments.author: Ian
comments.body:
Nate, don't feel bad about the tip you gave. You're at that age when you start to live in the past, when three dollars was probably extravagent. When people kept their lawns mown and kids showed respect.

Seriously, tho, Nate, I'd have tipped three and felt good about myself.

Btw I think I've got like a scalp pimple on the back of my head! Or it's a bite!

comments.author: erin
comments.body: im a terrible tipper i guess.

comments.author: Megster
comments.body:
hmmm..well...i hear at haruno on wednesdays after nine thirty...there's an awesome cocktail waitress who loves good tips...

and now i sort want pizza which...is ridiculous at ths hour...

and yea...i would've tipped five too...i'm a ridiculous tipper

comments.author: El Brian de Moore
comments.body:
yeah... i would have tipped five.. if it had been me
not saying anything about your 3 nate.. sorry... 3 is a fine tip
but ive been doing this for over 3 years now.. which is long enough to make me nearly over tip.. most places i go
hell.. ill give the sonic girl 3 bucks.. and she just walks about 15 feet at most... (i usually park close to the door)

comments.author: Megster
comments.body: brian...i would've tipped you more... i'm an insanely good tipper because i have been a waitress off and on for sooooooooooooooooo long...

comments.author: El Brian de Moore
comments.body:
3 was fine.. but if it had been me.. i would have expected 5.. because im so easy on the eyes
... if meg was still working there.. and i delivered to her.. i would have been okay with 3.. because shes a girl

comments.author: El Brian de Moore
comments.body:
oh.. and dan.. i have yet to make good friends with every manager...
so currently i can only swing such a thing.. when certain people are working
at some point it will surely happen

comments.author: dan
comments.body: Brian, the pizza for tickets trade is still available.

comments.author: nate
comments.body: Oh wow.  Three on ten wasn't enough?  I'm a former waiter!  I'm good with these things!

comments.author: El Brian de Moore
comments.body:
yeah... and you tipped him three bucks (i know stuff) i would have upped it to four.. because of the elevator.. wtf nate!?
and yes.. i am "open and stuff" as well as i like to be stalked
youre probably only the 3rd person thats called me because of facebook that didnt have my number previously

comments.author: nicole
comments.body: mmm, pizza.

comments.author: erin
comments.body: mmm pizza and milk.

comments.author: Ian
comments.body: But don't call them and ask Brian to come to your office!  Crazy fool!

comments.author: Ian
comments.body: 314-229-6794 is Brian's celldog.

comments.author: nate
comments.body:
Too late. I already did. And she said she would try but couldn't make promises. Then I called Brian on his cell by checking his Facebook, because he seemed like the type that would put his number on there - you know, very open and stuff.
None of it mattered: The pizza just arrived, and it was not carried by Brian. Nor was it a hot girl, which I told Brian would be the only acceptable substitute.
I thought about not even tipping the guy, but then I reconsidered. It's not his fault for not being Brian or a hot girl.

comments.author: nate
comments.body: Who do you deliver for again, Brian?

comments.author: Ian
comments.body:
I know Brian's at work now, so unless he delivers near his home and stops in to visit the Internet (which he does with frightening regularity), he'll be unable to answer you, Nate.

He delivers for Domino's, the one on National and Cherry. 831-1110. I've got it memorized.

comments.author: erin
comments.body:
i hope she wasnt talking about "drinking apple pie."

megster... you wouldnt dare promote drunken pizza delevery.

comments.author: El Brian de Moore
comments.body:
i want some apple pie!
im delivering again today... starting in about 30 minutes.. on through the night
someone call me with an address

comments.author: Ian
comments.body: RJ, one point.

comments.author: nate
comments.body:
Posted By: Megsterbrian... that sucks. better luck next time with your lady friend...and if you're delivering near phelps grove park, come in for some apple pie


This gives me a warm fuzzy feeling - the idea that you can be out working, driving around, and be able to stop randomly at a friend's house because you happened to be nearby and be fed pie. It's like a Frank Capra movie.

comments.author: Master RJ
comments.body:
Posted By: El Brian de Moorei made 34 deliveries during this "cozy evening" ......... i wasnt even scheduled to work tonight

.... suck


Sorry, Dante. I hope Randall can keep you company.

comments.author: Megster
comments.body: brian... that sucks.  better luck next time with your lady friend...and if you're delivering near phelps grove park, come in for some apple pie

comments.author: El Brian de Moore
comments.body:
i made 34 deliveries during this "cozy evening" ......... i wasnt even scheduled to work tonight

.... suck

comments.author: jhawk
comments.body:
YOU! You made this weather, didn't you, Nicole to get three nights off!!?? :)

Seriously, I DO worry about everyone else's horrible driving. I think most people know my stance on SGF drivers. ;)

Drive safe and we'll catch you guys this weekend some time...

comments.author: Master RJ
comments.body: Break in!

comments.author: nicole
comments.body: That means I have THREE nights off in a row. What have I done to deserve such great luck?

comments.author: dan
comments.body:
Sorry Jeff. I'm sure you could've expertly handled the drive here, but I didn't want other, less-experienced drivers to tempt fate. There's still plenty of time to see it.

Downtown is really eerie right now... all the businesses are slowing closing down, one by one.

comments.author: jhawk
comments.body:
Dammit. The perfect storm (so to speak) of weather, boredom, Metacritic and Moxie Forum members, and my excellent driving skillz led to the perfectly planned night...

*shakes tiny fist at the sky*

:(
